contributor.persName: Hans Adolph Brorson; adapted by N.F.S. Grundtvig

history.p: In a letter from February 1914 to his wife, Nielsen mentions having composed the hymn. From a surviving draft, it is clear that Nielsen's pupil, Paul Hellmuth, helped with the harmonization. Later the hymn was better known with Hans Adolph Brorson's original version of the text, 'Mit hjerte altid vanker'.

annot.p: Melody written by Nielsen, harmonization by Paul Hellmuth.

titlePage.p: Wilhelm Hansen Edition. No. 1985 / SALMER OG AANDELiGE SANGE / HALVHUNDRED NYE MELODIER FOR / HJEM * KIRKE OG SKOLE / Komponerede af CARL NiELSEN / FORLÆGGERENS EJENDOM FOR ALLE LANDE / KØBENHAVN & LEIPZIG / WILHELM HANSEN, MUSIK-FORLAG / KRISTIANIA & BERGEN / NORSK MUSIK-FORLAG / Brødrene Hals – Warmuth – Wilhelm Hansen. / STOCKHOLM & GÖTEBORG / A.B. NORDISKA MUSIKFÖRLAGET / Copyright 1919 by Wilhelm Hansen, Copenhagen

annot.p: Undated print with no indication of publisher; contains also Under Korset stod med Smerte (CNW 198).
